name: rbenv

subcommands.name: local
subcommands.description: Set or show the local application-specific Ruby version

subcommands.name: global
subcommands.description: Set or show the global Ruby version

subcommands.name: shell
subcommands.description: Set or show the shell-specific Ruby version
subcommands.usage:
rbenv shell <version>
rbenv shell -
rbenv shell --unset

subcommands.name: install
subcommands.description: Install a Ruby version using ruby-build
subcommands.usage:
rbenv install [-f|-s] [-kpv] <version>
rbenv install [-f|-s] [-kpv] <definition-file>
rbenv install -l|--list
rbenv install --version

options.description: Install even if the version appears to be installed already
Skip if the version appears to be installed already
Keep source tree in $RBENV_BUILD_ROOT after installation (defaults to $RBENV_ROOT/sources)
Apply a patch from stdin before building
Verbose mode: print compilation status to stdout
Attempt to remove the specified version without prompting for confirmation. If the version does not exist, do not display an error message.

subcommands.name: rehash
subcommands.description: Rehash rbenv shims (run this after installing executables)

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: Show the current Ruby version and its origin

subcommands.name: which
subcommands.description: Display the full path to an executable

subcommands.name: whence
subcommands.description: List all Ruby versions that contain the given executable

tldr:
> A tool to easily install Ruby versions and manage application environments.
> More information: <https://github.com/rbenv/rbenv>.

- Install a Ruby version:

`rbenv install {{version}}`

- Display a list of the latest stable versions for each Ruby:

`rbenv install --list`

- Display a list of installed Ruby versions:

`rbenv versions`

- Use a specific Ruby version across the whole system:

`rbenv global {{version}}`

- Use a specific Ruby version for an application/project directory:

`rbenv local {{version}}`

- Display the currently selected Ruby version:

`rbenv version`

- Uninstall a Ruby version:

`rbenv uninstall {{version}}`

- Display all Ruby versions that contain the specified executable:

`rbenv whence {{executable}}`
